meanings.definition: The melted residue of food in a pan.
meanings.sent1: After cooking the bacon, there was a sticky fondus left in the frying pan.
meanings.sent2: The chef scraped off the fondus from the bottom of the pot to make a delicious sauce.
meanings.sent3: The fondus in the pan looked like a colorful painting, but it was just burnt cheese.
meanings.sent4: The fondus clinging to the skillet seemed like a stubborn guest overstaying its welcome.
meanings.sent5: The fondus in the pan sizzled and crackled, releasing a tempting aroma.

meanings.definition: A ballet movement in which a dancer rises on the tips of the toes and sinks to the floor.
meanings.sent1: During the ballet performance, the ballerina executed a graceful fondus, captivating the audience.
meanings.sent2: The ballet instructor emphasized the importance of proper form when performing a fondus.
meanings.sent3: The dancer's fondus was so elegant that it seemed like she was floating on air.
meanings.sent4: Her fondus was like a delicate flower bending in the breeze, showcasing her strength and balance.
meanings.sent5: The fondus of the prima ballerina was the highlight of the entire performance.
